name: St. Abraham of Kashkar

locations.description: Founded Great Monastery on Mount Izla, Mesopotamia

summary: Abraham of Kashkar was a Syriac monk who founded the Great Monastery on Mount Izla in Mesopotamia. He was a key figure in the revival of East Syriac monasticism in the 6th century. His monastery became a major center of learning and spirituality for the Church of the East. He established strict monastic rules and his influence spread throughout the Persian Empire.
